task_description: Facing the building to your North-West (approx. 309°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: The top of the building is not visible, so I need to tilt my view upwards to see the entire structure before I can estimate its height.
I still cannot see the top of the building, so I need to tilt my view further upwards to get a full view of its height.
I still cannot see the top of the building, so I need to continue tilting my view upwards to see the full height.

Now that I can see the entire building from base to roof, I can estimate its height by counting the floors; it appears to have about 12 floors, and assuming each floor is approximately 3.5 meters high, the total height is around 42 meters.
